showScoreExcerpt: "This show is so special and unlike anything we have ever seen on Broadway...What strikes me is that it is so commercially successful, but before it was popular it was extremely well written and artistic. It is rare that these combine in a musical...'Hamilton' has shown the next generation of composers that you can write something intelligent with artistic merit and still sell tickets."

keyPhrases.quote: This show is so special and unlike anything we have ever seen on Broadway
you can write something intelligent with artistic merit and still sell tickets

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The review uses superlative language ('so special', 'unlike anything we have ever seen') and praises both artistic merit and commercial success, indicating unqualified enthusiasm. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses unqualified enthusiasm for the show, highlighting its unique blend of commercial success and artistic merit, indicating a strong recommendation.
